tweets.html:
I don't think LOST pioneered disappointing series finales. I do think it was a great advance in people being recreationally underwhelmed.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) December 19, 2011

If Joss Whedon made Lost, the love for it would power the internet.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) December 19, 2011

@corybarker And would have run only two seasons, plus a web comic, before getting canned - and Lost fans would be even MORE insufferable.

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) December 19, 2011

Everything I'm reading about "Homeland" is not crediting Carrie with what she did. Carrie would be so pissed.

— Lindsay Robertson (@lindsayism) December 19, 2011

In all the commercial hubbub, don't forget the reason for the season: The Doctor Who Christmas Special.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) December 19, 2011

At the risk of being untrue to my school ... holy crap "The Good Wife" is some damn fine network television.

— Hart Hanson (@HartHanson) December 19, 2011

So bored with articles against laff tracks. I'm now against all scores. You don't hear suspenseful music in real life. #Hahahahahahaha!

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) December 19, 2011

AP names Penn State scandal its "Sports Story of the Year." Don't think I want to go to the celebration party.

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) December 19, 2011

AT&T merger off. T-Mobile girl now in gray sweats spooning ice cream from carton: "Buy whatever plan you want. They're all the same."

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) December 19, 2011

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Pilot for Rob just arrived. Cancelling all plans for the rest of the day.

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) December 19, 2011

Charter names Rutledge CEO. There goes my theory he was going to replace Kim Jong-Il. Cablevision is good prep for N. Korea.

— Andrew Wallenstein (@awallenstein) December 19, 2011

It finally happened: I overdosed on "House Hunters International." I turned off an episode right before the guy was going to pick, even!

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) December 19, 2011

I just yelled "It's Bodie" at the TV while watching The Sopranos. I am alone right now. #waytooexcited #thewireisthegreatest

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) December 19, 2011

Just saw #Mission Impossible. It was a really long, super expensive episode of #chuck. Review: #Badasstunts #tomrunssocool #badwhitejeans

— Ali Adler (@AliAdler) December 20, 2011

Jessica Lange and Sam Shepard breaking up? Can't handle her success or did she catch him with the maid?

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) December 20, 2011

Watching an episode of Hawaii Five-0 set in North Korea. That place is wall to wall Jimmy Buffett and Alex O'Loughlin.

— June Thomas (@junethomas) December 20, 2011

When did Stuart Scott start dressing like an international jewel thief?

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) December 20, 2011

Power outage at #MNF game. God punishing world for Tebow loss with more Chris Berman time.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) December 20, 2011

ESPN's coverage of a 10-minute power outage is as awful and hyperbolic as you might expect.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) December 20, 2011

And now for something completely appalling... RT @tvguidemagazine: Monty Python's #JohnCleese to guest on #Whitney http://t.co/4yAh5dHa

— TVWithoutPity (@TVWithoutPity) December 19, 2011

NBC is pairing up Whitney with a new Chelsea Handler sitcom for a block they're calling "Fuck You Wednesdays."

— Will Goss (@williambgoss) December 20, 2011

In a healthy democracy, Kim Jong Un would have simply gotten a job on MSNBC , TODAYor ROCK CENTER.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) December 20, 2011

AND THE WINNER OF THE INTERNET IS: "Panda & Kitten Having Sex While Arguing 9/11 Was An Inside Job"

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) December 20, 2011

My parents very much enjoy 2 Broke Girls. CBS is doing things right.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) December 20, 2011

Law & Order: Law & Order

— Jason Mustian (@jasonmustian) December 20, 2011

Have you visited a third world country?RT @KimKardashian: Seeing @KendallJenner cry during her driver's test breaks my heart :-(

— kelly oxford (@kellyoxford) December 20, 2011

WORST. CBS PROCEDURAL PITCH. EVER. MT @TheEconomist Human body hair...has a real job to dohttp://t.co/kVrgbEK0

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) December 20, 2011

I don't think I can watch 'Dexter' with my sister ever again. #TVFinaleAngst

— Michael Burke (@chitownburke) December 19, 2011

I need someone to re-cut the Dexter-Deb scenes from the finale with A.) "Gravity" and B.) ABC's bouncy music.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) December 19, 2011

Colin Hanks menacingly eating Dexter's Cheerios is the absolutely highlight of this season. No question.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) December 19, 2011

Every time I see that ridiculous #Dexter painting, I think "this show was nominated for an Emmy last year." And then the tears come.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) December 20, 2011

Effffff youuuuuuuu Dexter.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) December 20, 2011

Alerting that jackass in FL: Tonight's #RockCenter profiles a Muslim comedy troupe! You could threaten to boycott it! If we weren't already.

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) December 20, 2011

I like that Homeland scored big for Showtime. Critical acclaim + passionate fans + commercial success = the dream. Bring on S2!

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) December 20, 2011

Twitter's spellcheck is a lot like the Canadian TV industry. Neither recognize the word 'showrunner'.

— Jason Belleville (@bigbelleville) December 20, 2011

is the cameraman on meth?! #VH1Divas

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) December 20, 2011

Just recognized Jesse Williams and Aaron Paul in that Ciroc commercial with Diddy. So they're auditioning for the new reboot of Entourage?

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) December 20, 2011

Kurt Hummel will be wearing a one-piece leather onesie in #GLEE. @ChrisColfer says his ass looked good. I don't know what to do right now.

— Kath Skerry (@KathSkerry) December 20, 2011

Only one bottle of wine for the two-hour Terra Nova finale/review tonight. Pray for me.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) December 19, 2011

I'm frightened by the amount that television reviewers are inspired to drink when forced to watch Terra Nova. #prayformojo #andcancellation

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) December 19, 2011

Really wish there was a Christmas episode of TERRA NOVA. I would love to see baby raptors wearing Santa hats.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) December 19, 2011

Why is TERRA NOVA getting invaded? Please tell me it's to take that little girl to another TV series.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) December 20, 2011

What the actual fuck is happening on Terra Nova right now? I have no clue. Shit's blowing up and i am all "lolwut"

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) December 20, 2011

Gonna have to get off Twitter for Terra Nova spoilers. Haha no j/k it's Old Republic time.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) December 20, 2011

No show writes in cool scenes to happen OFFSCREEN more than #TerraNova. They have it down to an art form.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

OH GOD NOT MORE INCEST. #TerraNova

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

It's incredibly clear this should have been a 4-hour TV movie. #TerraNova

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

OK, that was really well done. Kudos, #TerraNova. Way to find a spine 12.5 hours in.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

Who did Stephen Lang piss off to have to speak this kind of dialogue? Ugh. #TerraNova

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

Truth be told, at this point, I'm watching #TerraNova to see what @TVMcGee is talking about. #moralsupport

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) December 20, 2011

I love that #TerraNova commissioned exactly one piece of orchestral music for the entire season.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

HAHAHAHA. Oh man. That was funny. Wait, that wasn't supposed to be? Oh. #TerraNova

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

It's good to know that bat shit crazy protects you from bullets, but a survival vest does nothing for knives. #TerraNova

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) December 20, 2011

Commenter on tonight's #TerraNova review: "You are everything wrong with television." I'm not even on TV. I RULE.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 20, 2011

If a slightly modified version of this had been the Terra Nova pilot, I might have been more excited about this show.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 20, 2011

"If you need another hug, just ask." WHO WRITES THIS SHOW #TerraNova

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) December 20, 2011

Partial list of things better than Terra Nova: gout, cold cooked spinach, brutalist architecture, wool underpants.

— Ian Bogost (@ibogost) December 20, 2011

H&M releases "girl with the dragon tattoo" fashion line. Okay the only movie less fashion inspired is Arthur Christmas.

— Dana Weiss (@Possessionista) December 20, 2011

I've never hated a character the way I hate poor Skyler. #BreakingBad

— John Reindeerhoof (@johnvanderhoef) December 20, 2011

things that can't be unseen: the kardashian family holiday card.

— get rid of the nazis says candice misandrist (@candicetobin) December 20, 2011

"You gonna invite us in, Reggie?" Dickie Bennett is a vampire! #Justified

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) December 20, 2011

Oh Mags. I could listen to you talk about the gates of hell opening all day. #Justified

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) December 20, 2011

Kim is that Cheri Oteri character from SNL. "I take these to keep me up! and I take these to keep me down!" #RHOBH

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) December 20, 2011

I wonder if Danny Glover ever watches the first Lethal Weapon and thinks: I was too young to be too old for that shit.

— Martyn Pedler (@martynpedler) December 20, 2011

Accidentally typed the word "pimplications" in a review, and am now determined to find a way to use it. Too bad HUNG's over.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) December 20, 2011
